poem:
Title: "Of Power Shifts and Quiet Earth"

In this thin veil of dawn,
London turns its face,
Quiet as Dorset fields hum of change.
The blue's hold wanes, yellow ascends,
In Tiverton, Honiton, whispers stir.
Ed Davey speaks, the echo, a westward wind.
History, sleeping, slowly awakes,
In Frome and Somerton's aged lanes.
Behold, the quiet revolution of the heartland,
The simplicity of politics, mapped in earth and stone.
